page.title: 01CRESWELL COLLIERY
page.content: Creswell is the main settlement in our area. It was developed at the beginning of this century when the Bolsover Colliery Company established a coal mine here. The sinking of the first shaft started in 1894 and Creswell Colliery started producing coal in 1897. There are two shafts at the colliery. No.1 shaft goes down to a depth of 300 metres and is used for winding the coal. No.2 shaft goes down to a depth of 800 metres and is used for manriding and materials only. All current production is from the Threequarter Seam and present output is about 3,000 tonnes per day. The average annual output is 700,000 tonnes of coal. Over 1,000 men are employed at Creswell Colliery.
